body_html: @fayeshine: Yep, the cleanest way is probably to make all the C++ resize ops accept any number of dimensions >= 3 and treat the initial dims-3 dimensions as batch. There are a lot of other ops that behave this way: mixing together the last few dimensions and broadcasting over the first few.
body_text: @fayeshine: Yep, the cleanest way is probably to make all the C++ resize ops accept any number of dimensions >= 3 and treat the initial dims-3 dimensions as batch.  There are a lot of other ops that behave this way: mixing together the last few dimensions and broadcasting over the first few.
body: @fayeshine: Yep, the cleanest way is probably to make all the C++ resize ops accept any number of dimensions >= 3 and treat the initial dims-3 dimensions as batch.  There are a lot of other ops that behave this way: mixing together the last few dimensions and broadcasting over the first few.
